pull.title: p2p: add more bad ports
pull.body: Add a few more ports used by extremely well adopted services that require authentication and really ought not be used by bitcoin nodes for p2p traffic.

events.body:

ACK 23a7807ec6d35d3ef5b65e4abc3b3841e84b702e

Verified that these are indeed the default ports and that the docs match the code.
Have a miner test suggestion, LGTM otherwise.

ACK [8716fd2](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32826/commits/8716fd2f4a00b07426e54a1491af421d6345f708)

It makes sense to me to add these ports since they're popular and used. I double-checked the links @l0rinc provided and also did a quick search myself to make sure they were correct
Please squash your commits according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits

events.body:
utACK 6967e8e8abbc35ac98e8e3745a8bbed56e77526f

I checked that the ports make sense.

ACK 6967e8e8abbc35ac98e8e3745a8bbed56e77526f

Changes since my last review are comment updates and namespace inlines.

My only remaining concern is the unnecessary heavy memory usage of the test - but it's not a blocker.

comments.body: instead of updating the comment to match the code (which is the ultimate source of truth anyway), seems like a good opportunity to remove the duplication of the code below - which is already trivial, no need for a dead comment that doesn't add any new info.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -921,10 +921,14 @@ bool IsBadPort(uint16_t port)
     case 1720:  // h323hostcall
     case 1723:  // pptp
     case 2049:  // nfs
+    case 3306:  // MySQL

@@ -921,10 +921,14 @@ bool IsBadPort(uint16_t port)
     case 1720:  // h323hostcall
     case 1723:  // pptp
     case 2049:  // nfs
+    case 3306:  // MySQL
+    case 3389:  // RDP / Windows Remote Desktop

@@ -921,10 +921,14 @@ bool IsBadPort(uint16_t port)
     case 1720:  // h323hostcall

+    case 3389:  // RDP / Windows Remote Desktop
     case 3659:  // apple-sasl / PasswordServer
     case 4045:  // lockd

     case 5061:  // sips
+    case 5432:  // PostgreSQL

@@ -921,10 +921,14 @@ bool IsBadPort(uint16_t port)
     case 1720:  // h323hostcall

     case 6669:  // Alternate IRC
     case 6697:  // IRC + TLS
     case 10080: // Amanda
+    case 27017: // MongoDB

comments.body:
might as well inline it now that it's only used once
```suggestion
    BOOST_CHECK_EQUAL(std::ranges::count_if(ports, IsBadPort), 85);
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -87,10 +87,14 @@ incoming connections.
     1720:  h323hostcall
     1723:  pptp
     2049:  nfs
+    3306:  MySQL
+    3389:  RDP / Windows Remote Desktop
comments.body: Trying to connect to (or open( that port sounds like a great way to be flagged as malware / attacker.

Got nerd-sniped by this commit using `list` for no reason and was about to suggest `vector<uint16_t>` as a better default. But a `view` is nicer conceptually and slightly nicer on the cache (memory usage difference seems negligible).

```
₿ poop "./build/bin/test_bitcoin_list -t netbase_tests/isbadport" "./build/bin/test_bitcoin_vector16 -t netbase_tests/isbadport"
Benchmark 1 (43 runs): ./build/bin/test_bitcoin_list -t netbase_tests/isbadport
  measurement          mean ± σ            min … max           outliers         delta
  wall_time           117ms ± 1.45ms     117ms …  125ms          2 ( 5%)        0%
```
